name: Hotel Aragon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I stayed here recently and would recommend it based on cleanliness & location. The room was a good size but we had a superior room according to the booking so cant comment on other rooms. The bathroom was a great size with his/her taps! The room also had a small toilet room with sofa and chairs. Bed was comfortable and curtains were good and prevented light streaming in. The breakfast consisted of fruit, breads, cold meats, youghurts and boiled eggs which was good. The hotel is located around the corner from the market sq and I can say the street is very quiet with good restaurants and bars nearby. MY COMPLAINT - may have been a communication error but I still found it incredibly unprofessional and not something you would expect when you are paying $130 euro a night. We had presumed check out was at 12 (like most hotels around the world) as check in is at 3pm which is quite late however following breakfast we decided to have a snooze as hate a lateish night and in the middle of our nap, we were woken up by knocking on the door at 11.15 by a cleaner who asked us when we were leaving ?? (which in itself is not how the situation should be handled), we say 12 and she told us check out was at 11 - we apologised and said we would be out in 15 minutes (as we then had to shower, pack & get ourselves together. Over 5 minutes later the phone rang and it was reception who once again asked us when we were leaving and we apologised and said we thought check out was at 12 and we would be out soon. She said that was fine and we assured we would be out by 12 (it was now 11.25ish). 5 minutes later we had another knock on the door and this time the cleaner shouted at us to get out of the room to which I stood in complete shock at the behavior of this person. That of course put the nail in the coffin of my partner who thengot very irritated. As we left the room the cleaner was then waiting outside and apologised and pointed to her watch ??!! I had presumed she had heard my partners rant ! There were no apologises from reception. I would have recommended this hotel highly an hour before our departure but they need to make you aware of check out time and they didnt actually tell us when breakfast was as we had to ask and there was no hotel brochure in the room which normally details this information. I would not stay here again as no mater how late someone is checking out (within reason) I dont expect some cleaner to come shouting at my door .
reviews.title: Nice Hotel, Great Location, Shame About Staff And Unprofessional Behaviour

likes.liked: — NICE COMFORTABLE ROOM AND GOOD LOCATION

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: The recent bank holiday May weekend made a Eurostar package trip to Bruges a pleasant change of scenery. Hotel Aragon/Aragon House was an offered selection as part of the rail trip which included their cold buffet breakfast of meats, cheeses, juices, croissants, rolls, yogurt, boiled eggs, fruits and coffee/tea. Everything was fresh and delicious.
reviews.title: Very clean and convenient

likes.disliked: — street noise noticed in one bedroom

reviews.title: Good location/facility/brkfst. Walls a bit thin
reviews.text: The hotel graciously upgraded us to the apartment component of their accomodations (around the corner from the hotel )since our visit included myself, my husband and teenage daughter. The spacious apartment included two separate large bedrooms with TV sets, sitting room, one bathroom with double sinks and kitchenette with refrigerator and microwave. It could have easily housed a family with young children or a few adults together. The beds were comfortable and everything was clean with plenty of pillows and blankets if needed. Some street noise was evident even though we were on the 3rd floor especially if windows were opened. However, air conditioning was available if needed.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was conveniently located about a 5 minute walk from the Markt and Burg. However, it would be a strenous walk with luggage from the train station on the cobblestones which predominate the city. We took a local bus right outside the train station with minimal difficulty. English is widely spoken and many different buses go in the direction of the Markt Square. When bought at the ticket booth very close to the rail station, the fee was about a Euro and a half per person. We were able to purchase tickets from the driver at the stop on the way back. Taxis were another option although we didn't use them.
reviews.title: Very good hotel, excellent location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Bruges is a very walkable city which is clean and quaint with its canals, beautiful churches and unique architecture. Around most corners is a picture opportunity along with the chocolate and lace stores which highlight this Belgium location.
reviews.title: A great central hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Booked this hotel, just off the main square, after a trip advisor search - at that time if booking it was rated the best hotel in Bruges. Certainly from our experience it well deserves that rating. Booking for 4 nights we automatically received an upgrade to an executive room - which as previous reviewers have identified are well worth considering. However, on arrival we were advised that we had been transferred to an apartment in a block just round the corner from the hotel. It was fabulous and ideal for our needs. I guess larger again than an executive room it had a small kitchen with microwave and cooker. For us this was ideal as we like to do a bit of self-catering - and considering the cost of eating out in Bruges (and the somewhat repetitive menus on offer) was ideal on this occasion. Particularly as on our very first walk around the city we discovered a small food shop off the beaten track - very popular with locals - selling freshly prepared meals for the microwave. As a result of this discovery and the facilities we now had available, an evening meal for two was prepared afora total cost of 10 euros! Returning to the hotel the service was exceptional as was the cleanliness and the short stroll to breakfast in the morning well worth the effort. If you have an eye for a bargain - consider asking for a studio apartment rather than an executive room.
reviews.title: Apartment transfer much appreciated

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012
reviews.text: Overall, the hotel was good. But a critical break in service spoiled the stay. I had a dreadful slip and fall getting out of the shiwer one morning. Found later I had cracked three ribs
reviews.title: Break in service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012
reviews.text: Told the person at the front desk very soon afterwards. Little concern showed. Asked that afternoon for some sort of rubber mat later that day. Little response even after the reason was explained---again. Nothing was done.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Perhaps the staff could be informed to respond to such urgent requests, even if from soft-spoken, non-screaming guests!
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Great,no problems, very clean, ideal location,breakfast as expected, helpful staff. Car park tight but secure, only stayed 2 nights but wish we could stay more.
reviews.title: Excellent Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Stayed at this hotel with my wife, mother and father in law and sister in law and her husband. Can't recommend this hotel highly enough for any Bruges trip. It's about a 3-4 minute walk off the square and the hotel itself is fantastic. My wife and I have stopped at a couple of Bruges hotels and this is by far the best. The rooms are very well equipped and the bathroom is one of the nicest hotel bathrooms I have ever had.
reviews.title: Great location and fantastic rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would recommend this hotel to all my friends and family.
reviews.title: our stay in Bruges

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very nice hotel, great location, great rooms and bathrooms. Really good breakfast buffet as well. Our room was not in the main building sos the Wifi connection was not good at all. This is something they need to improve as the cost for the room was quite high. But overall, this was a wonderful place to stay with great staff! Loved it!
reviews.title: Better than chocolate!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our first visit to Bruges, again booked through Groupon, so I had high hopes after our Lisbon trip that this hotel would also be good. We werent disappointed! This is a lovely hotel situated just a short walk from the main market square. Our room was actually an apartment, with a small kitchen, sitting area, very comfortable bed, tv, mini bar, large bathroom with bath and shower, and safety deposit box in the wardrobe (key available at reception). The bed was very comfortable with lovely soft pillows and extra quilt if needed. Also there was a good air conditioning unit in the room that acts to both heat and cool down. We didnt have a great view from the back of the hotel, however there were two large windows that made the room feel very bright. The only downside was the three flights of very narrow stairs, but there was a lift that would accept one person at a time! The hotel itself is well decorated and modern. On the first night we had a complimentary welcome drink in the bar. The hotel doesnt have a restaurant in the evening, however with so many to choose from just a short walking distance this certainly wasnt a problem! Breakfast was continental with a good variety of cheese, meat, fresh fruit, cereals etc, the dining room again very clean and tastefully decorated. The reception staff were very friendly and helpful. You can store your luggage in a special room, but this isnt kept locked. Eating in Bruges is a calorific affair, chips with everything, waffles and beer - over 1100 of them and of course chocolate!! I made the mistake of asking for my steak cooked 'medium'. Be warned, here it is taken that if you want medium it is medium rare! If you like your steak to have seen a frying pan, then best ask for well done! All chips are served with mayonnaise unless you specify tomato sauce, but also be warned you can get charged for this - we had 1 euro added to a lunch bill for a dollop of sauce!! There are many chocolate shops to choose from, all selling very similar things but at different prices, so check a few out before buying! The boat tour is very good value at around half an hour for 7.60 euros, a good way to see some of the city sights. The best way however is on foot, the pony and trap rides very expensive unless several of you share - 35 euros, and the city bus tour at 14.50 euros for 50 mins would suit the less agile. Most of the streets are cobbled so good footwear is essential, and beware the taxi drivers and pony and traps, they show no mercy for a tourist who steps in their way!! The main square and the sights around it were very crowded, even at 10.30am, so we got off the beaten track a little, and walked through some of the very pretty residential areas down towards the windmills at the perimeter of the city, it is definitely worth venturing further afield to escape all the other tourists. An excellent trip, with good rail links from Bruges to Brussels within an hour. For those who travel on Eurostar and havent been before, Brussels has three stations, Eurostar is situated in the South one.
reviews.title: Really lovely mid-range hotel, excellent location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked Hotel Aragon as part of a package and so I was delighted when we arrived. Very nice hotel, rooms were absolutely lovely, very clean, very large, great bathrooms, lots of light (but great blackout curtains too!). Reception were polite and friendly with good recommendations for dinner. Breakfast was also very good - continental including smoked salmon and with the added bonus of boiled eggs! We had a welcome drink in the bar included in our package which was *very* generous!
reviews.title: A Little Gem!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We travelled to Bruges with my cousins in Feb 07. The hotel was very clean and comfortable (although a little Smokey - try to req a non-smoking room if pos). We checked in rather late as we came from the Euro star and the night staff were really nice. In fact the overall service of the hotel was great. The breakfast (typical European) was good enough to start the day. However the best thing about this hotel is its location. It’s right next to the Mkt square and easy walking distance to all attractions in Bruges. Would highly recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Great Hotel in Great Location

likes.disliked: — The smoke smell in the room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2005, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel had a lovely room, very nice bathroom too and nice little balcony. It was in a fab location as it was a minutes walk from the centre. The breakfast was lovely, plenty of choice. I think a 3 day stay in Bruges is enough time to do everything, don't forget to visit the chocolatiers and go up the bell tower. The chocolate museum is also interesting and you get to try choccies just freshly made too.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Was a lovely trip and would definitely stay in this hotel again.
reviews.title: Pleasant stay

likes.disliked: — No tea and coffee facilities in room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Third time in Brugges. Third different hotel.
reviews.title: Great little hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great value friendly hotel ideally situated and unlike many, breakfast included.
reviews.title: Only one night but excellent.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I and two lady friends stayed there for 4 nights and had a very pleasant time.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel, enjoyable two night stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was good - don't expect full English, this is Belgium. Having spent many years working on the 'continent', this was a pefectly good 'continental breakfast'. My only concerm was the somewhat meagre and limited bar service. A lock up cabinet in the lounge with limited opening hours.
reviews.title: perfect in every way

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Got talking to some people staying at the adjoining Aragon Rooms 'Appartel'. Sounds interesting. If I go again, may give it a try.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel, Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This small hotel was a splendid surprise for us on our first night in Brugge (we flew into Amsterdam and took the train immediately to Brugge). We were tired from the overnight flight and then a 3 1/2 hr. train ride, and what we needed was a quiet night's sleep - and that's exactly what we got.
reviews.title: Thoroughy Satisfied with the Hotel Aragon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The continental breakfast was the standard fare, and the dining room is a cheerful place to eat in the morning. The staff was outstanding, and helpful with all our questions and needs.
reviews.title: Great location in a lovely old town

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The room was clean as were the public rooms of the hotel...just one oddity: The door between the bedroom and the bathroom was glass - like a shower door. No lock, and space at the top and bottom of the door. No big deal, just odd.
reviews.title: Great location, pity about the beds!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Brugge particularly because of the perfect location to Markt Square.
reviews.title: Nice but not luxury

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the Hotel Aragon in October for two nights and we loved every minute of our visit. We went with another couple and throroughly enjoyed Brugges and all it has to offer.
reviews.title: Hotel Aragon was great

likes.liked: — Great location, wonderful room and super staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: In November, 2007 my husband and I stayed at this hotel. We were so satisfied with our visit that we booked again with our son and his family in June 2010. I am remiss in not posting a review sooner.
reviews.title: The True Value of a Hotel Sometimes is the Staff.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012
reviews.text: All the accolades given this hotel are, IMO, deserving. This review is to acknowledge Astrid, a front desk staff member. One of our family member had a medical emergency late on a Sunday afternoon. We couldn't find a pharmacy, and a hospital was far away. Astrid kept her composure and got a taxi cab driver to transport him to a doctor's office. She is professional, intelligent and quick thinking. What she accomplished in minutes was a blessing...we as tourists did not have the resources to get medical aid.
reviews.title: Excellent, highly recommended
Very good location
reviews.text: Sometimes it is the people who make a difference. Thank you Astrid!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We stayed in the apartments, which were fantastic. Good sized bedrooms, decent living room and kitchen, but the location is very good indeed. Short walk to the Markt, and plenty of nice places to see and eat in nearby. Parking is in underground carpark about 3 minutes walk away, good value at €8 for 24hrs. Breakfast was spot on, very good range. Overall, highly recommended, especially for those with young families.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: I returned again to this hotel because it is a comfortable hotel. It is worth paying slightly more for a bigger room as some of the rooms did look small but they are adequate if you just need a bed.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel for Families.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As we were staying for 3 nights we were upgraded to one of the apartments. The apartment was very well kept, clean and comfortable. Ideal for a base to explore Bruges. The staff were fabulous - very helpful and courteous.
reviews.title: Smart, clean, friendly central hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: Breakfast was served in two dining areas with a good range of cold buffet items.
reviews.title: Perfect!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: Overall stay was excellent value.
reviews.title: Quiet Clean Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: I took my 13 year old daughter to Brugge for a short city break, not really knowing what to expect!. I had never booked a holiday online before, neither had stayed in a hotel that I was not advised by a travel agent before.
reviews.title: Great Hotel
Can't miss!
reviews.text: We went by Eurostar from Waterloo, another first, and I have to say it was for me much better than flying. We then took the train from Brussels to Brugge. The hotel was a 10 minute bus ride away, everyone spoke English as were very helpful with getting the correct bus and the right ticket etc.

description: Restored mansion, comfortable rooms with English fabrics; centrally located in historic, medieval area.
